About Me

BIO

Experienced Researcher and a passionate developer with working experience in Social media text analytics, Big Data.
Skilled data engineer with experience in Python, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Text Mining, Information Retrieval, Ontology modeling, Semantic Web Technologies Web Development, Data Visualization, Query processing.
Strong data science and analytics professional with a Master's degree in Computer Science and Engineering from Wright State University with a GPA of 3.857.
Favourite pass-time is to read books and explore GitHub repositories for inspiring ideas and techniques.

Graduate Research Assistant

Wright State University

▪ Worked closely with PHDs, professors, senior developers, industry collaborators and domain experts to implement and deliver new ideas to tackle the outdated technologies.
▪ Crawled and maintained social media data during major natural disasters.
▪ Grabed data via web scraping, API interfaces in JSON formats.
▪ Explored Semantic web technologies and performed ontological modeling.
▪ Leveraged Data Visualization techniques to study data.
▪ Contributed to design and developments of UI, Server side and Database components.
▪ Developed solutions using Python and JavaScript for real-time application.
▪ Set up ElasticSearch mapping, indexes and formulated queries.
▪ Provided modules for use as Restful web API services as per collaborator's requirements.
▪ Created and submitted research papers and reports.
▪ Experimented and incorporated IBM services and deployed on IBM cloud using Kubernetes cluster.
▪ Performed end user A/B testing.
▪ Maintained and added improvements with new features and modules.

Master's Thesis

Wright State University

▪ Multi-Scale and Multi-Modal Streaming Data Aggregation and Processing for Decision Support during Natural Disasters.
▪ Provides Map visualization of Disaster Relief, Coordination and Response meeting the requirements of the humaniratian world with features like route guidance, need match-making, situational awareness, community and individual level aggregation and analysis.
▪ Leveraged Machine Learning, Topic Modeling, NLP, Ontology Modeling to devise a tool that is being integrated in real-time android applications in the humanitarian world.

Achievements

CallForCode PARTICIPATION -
▪ Led a group of 4 developers to participate in IBM’s Call For Code, a developer’s challenge with the tool DisasterRecord.
▪ Tested, evaluated and integrated IBM Cloud services.
▪ Deployed the tool on IBM Cloud.
▪ Resources : Wiki page, YouTube video

PUBLICATION -
▪ Kar, S., Al-Olimat, HS . Thirunarayan, K., Shalin, V., Sheth, A., and Parthasarathy, S. “D-record: Disaster Response and Relief Coordination Pipeline”. In Proceedings of the ACM SIGSPATIAL International Workshop on Advances in Resilient and Intelligent Cities (ARIC 2018). ACM, 2018.
▪ Resources : Paper

TALKS -
▪ Collection, extraction, evaluation techniques for “Location-centric event ontological modeling” as a guest presenter at Advanced Semantic web class Fall 2018, WSU.
▪ Extensive talks on word embedding and text features.

TRAVEL AWARD -
